data.title: PARTNER CONTEXT
data.introduction: Think about the partner or partners you have been involved with sexually during the last year.

questions_id.text: Do you have a primary sex partner – a man you have sex with on a regular basis, or who you consider as your main partner?
questions_id.description:
If yes, please think about that person when you respond.
If you do not currently have a primary sex partner, but have had a primary sex partner in the past year, please think about that person when you respond.
If you have not had a primary sex partner in the last year, is there another recent partner who has had more “say” or more influence over your ability to use HIV prevention products? If yes, think about that person when you respond.
If you have not had a primary sex partner and there is no other partner who influences your use of HIV prevention methods, please think about the sexual partner you have had sex with most recently when you respond.

options_id.text: Non-current sex partner, from past year

questions_id.text: Does your primary partner know that you are taking oral PrEP?
questions_id.description: Does your primary partner know that you are taking oral PrEP?

questions_id.text: What was your partner’s reaction when he found out about your PrEP use?
questions_id.description: What was your partner’s reaction when he found out about your PrEP use?

data.title: TRADITIONAL VALUES
data.introduction: This first section is about how do you feel about the kind of roles that men and women should have in their everyday lives.

questions_id.text: Changing diapers, giving the children a bath, and feeding the kids is a mother's responsibility.
A woman cannot refuse to have sex with her husband or boyfriend.
If a man has paid bride wealth for his wife, he owns her.
A woman should always listen and abide by the word of her husband or boyfriend without questions.
A man should have the final word about decisions in the home.
A real man produces a male child.
If a man has paid bride wealth for his wife, she must have sex when he wants it.
A man should have the final say in all family matters.
A woman should accept her partner's wishes – even when she disagrees - to keep the family together.
I only think I am attractive if other people think I am.

data.title: PARTNER ABUSE AND CONTROL
data.introduction: How does your partner treat you? Some of these questions might be difficult for you to answer. Please take your time and please respond as honestly and openly as you can.

questions_id.text: My partner slaps, hits, kicks, or pushes me.
My partner does things to scare or intimidate me on purpose.
My partner makes fun of me or humiliates me.
I feel frightened by what my partner says or does.
I can't seem to make good decisions about my life.
I do not trust myself to make good decisions about my life.

data.title: PARTNER SUPPORT
data.introduction: Consider how much or how little support you might receive or have received from the partner you were thinking of in section 1

questions_id.text: My partner is as committed as I am to our relationship.
In general, my relationship has a lot of tension.
I feel trapped or stuck in our relationship.
Arguments with my partner result in me feeling down or bad about myself.
My partner does what he wants, even if I do not want him to.
I feel safe in my current relationship.

data.title: PARTNER ATTITUDE TO HIV PREVENTION
data.introduction: How do you think your partner will react to discussing HIV prevention?

questions_id.text: If I asked my partner to use a condom, he would get angry.
If I asked my partner to use an HIV prevention product, he would get violent.
If I asked my partner to use a condom, he would get violent.
If I asked my partner to use a condom, he would think I'm having sex with other people.
I cannot tell my partner about HIV prevention product use because he will become angry.

data.title: HIV PREVENTION READINESS
data.introduction: How do you feel about using an HIV prevention product – in this case, oral PrEP?

questions_id.text: Using an HIV prevention product with my partner will help us communicate better.
I worry that others will think I am cheating with many partners if they know I am using the product.
I worry that my partner will think I do not trust him because I am using the product.
I am nervous to learn what my HIV status is.
I worry that the product will affect my sex life.
